entry.value:
Normalized Cases per Country (Shifted) : days passed since that country had at least 1 case every 10k people for the first time.%%00010
%%00010Each line represents a different country measuring on the x axis the days passed since the first time with at least 1 case every 10k people. %%00010
%%00010Each country is then shifted relatively to the day the disease began seriously to spread in that same country.%%00010
%%00010You can use the chart to compare countries based on how fast the disease is spreading.%%00010
%%00010Click on legend labels on the right to filter by country.%%00010
%%00010To add more countries click on the settings button [â‰¡] in the top right corner.

%%00010
